The fixes we have in place include some time-consuming database migrations.  During...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet Gallery Performance Issues
FeedItems.Summary: Since August 16th, and especially since August 21st, the NuGet Gallery has been exhbiting intermittent performance issues.  Some users are reporting errors when attempting to browse or search for...

FeedItems.Title: Results of NuGet CDN Experiment
FeedItems.Summary: A little over a week ago, we asked for your help with an experimentt that we were conducting to see whether there was value in enabling CDN support for our packages blob storage container.  Over 100...

FeedItems.Title: Help Us Test CDN for NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary: Over the past few weeks, we’ve been investigating whether to turn on the content delivery network (CDN) feature of the Azure blob storage container for NuGet packages.  In theory, this would make...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet 2.0 Released
FeedItems.Summary: We’re happy to announce that we released NuGet 2.0 on 6/19/2012. This release includes support for grouping dependencies, tools and content by the target framework of the project. Additionally, we’ve...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet 1.8 Hotfix Released
FeedItems.Summary:
With the NuGet 1.8 release, we found a breaking change that caused NuGet to fail on Windows XP machines.  Earlier today, we released a hotfix to NuGet 1.8 that addresses this.

We apologize for any...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet 1.8 Released
FeedItems.Summary: We’re happy to announce that we released NuGet 1.8 on 5/23/2012. This release includes support for localized satellite assemblies, nuget.exe performance improvements, and 34 bug fixes. Details are in...

FeedItems.Title: Package Restore and Consent
FeedItems.Summary:
A little while back, our team had the pleasure of talking about NuGet with some privacy experts. These are folks who are passionate about your privacy and laws that protect your privacy.

As we were...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet's Sources Are Moving to Git
FeedItems.Summary: At the end of April, we’ll be moving the NuGet sources hosted on CodePlex from a Mercurial repository to a Git repository. This won’t impact or affect NuGet users, but NuGet contributors and those...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet 1.7 Released
FeedItems.Summary: We’re happy to announce that we released NuGet 1.7 today. This release includes several new features as well as over 75 bug fixes. Details are in the NuGet 1.7 Release Notes.

FeedItems.Title: The NuGet Gallery Outage on March 9th
FeedItems.Summary: The NuGet Gallery was unavailable on March 9th from approximately midnight until 7:52 A.M., nearly eight hours. During this time all HTTP requests to the gallery website failed. In addition to...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing the NuGet Team Blog
FeedItems.Summary:
For the last few months, the NuGet team has been considering starting a proper, official blog. This is that blog.

How do we plan to use this blog? Here are a few ways we know we’ll use it (and I’m...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Display License file from blob storage" (#6675) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
With given package, we show the license content from blob storage.
Fix: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6518

Will add test cases for this later.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "License storage related methods extracted into their own class" (#6674) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on #6533 .

Extracted the license-related methods into their own storage abstraction class, so it can be used on its own in Orchestrator.

Had to pretty much rewrite on of the `StorageDependentFacts` tests to accommodate the change. Need to confirm with @dtivel that I understood the intention properly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Mark 405 response code as "success" for AI" (#6669) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6651

Wasn't able to find any unit tests that verify that our `RequestTelemetryProcessor` considers 400, 404, and 405 successful, but I verified locally that they are.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Targeted block for invalidly URL encoded license URLs for license expressions" (#6673) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Use CachingSecretReader from ServerCommon" (#6672) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
To unblock https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/6665, I propose we use ServerCommon's CachingSecretReader in Gallery. This includes the following changes:
- Adds 24-hour refresh interval
- Thread safety changes by @loic-sharma 
- Support for secret expiration, needed for auto-rotation of storage credentials (from PS gallery team)

Local testing against DEV looks good, but let me know if there are any concerns with this.

/cc @xavierdecoster

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Use CachingSecretReader from ServerCommon" (#6672) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
To unblock https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/6665, I propose we use ServerCommon's CachingSecretReader in Gallery. This includes the following changes:
- Adds 24-hour refresh interval
- Thread safety changes by @loic-sharma 
- Support for secret expiration, needed for auto-rotation of storage credentials (from PS gallery team)

Local testing against DEV looks good, but let me know if there are any concerns with this.

/cc @xavierdecoster

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Documentation preview when adding new package does not work" (#6671) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I'm currently adding a new NuGet package via NuGet.org and I'm having issue previewing my documentation. Indeed, when I type something in the textarea then click on "Preview", the textarea disappear but what I wrote in it does not appear on the page.

So I type something:

![01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10199821/48551215-33d3d980-e8d5-11e8-86a8-d8b2907f9f5b.png)

Then I click "Preview":

![02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10199821/48551224-3b937e00-e8d5-11e8-96d0-cefaa29153f0.png)

And nothing appears. I also tried to edit an existing package with a documentation already written and I'm having the same issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Release version 4.8.1 of nuget packages" (#7504) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Since 4.8.1 is now finally recommended, packages on nuget.org should be updated to 4.8.1:

- https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.CommandLine/
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Frameworks/
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Common/
- etc

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Visual studio 2017 version 15.8.9 freeze on nuget installation" (#7490) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi, i started working with xamarin.forms and created a .netstandard xamarin.forms project.
after the last update i cant install any nuget package to my android project, with command or the gui.

I read this problem exited in the old update but now i see this problem with the latest version of vs.

is there any solution i can try ?

With Regards 
Alen Toma

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet pack fails with paket and .NET Core 2.1.500" (#7514) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @dbrattli on November 15, 2018 17:33_

## Steps to reproduce

Add Paket to any project and run `dotnet pack` will fail after installing .NET Core 2.1.500. The error message is `The provided SymbolPackageFormat value  is invalid.`. It seems to be breaking since the new property does not have a default.

This issue is tracked in the Paket manager at: https://github.com/fsprojects/Paket/issues/3427 

## Expected  behavior

`dotnet pack` should succeed.

## Actual behavior

Fails with error:

```
➜  classlib dotnet pack                  
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 15.9.20+g88f5fadfbe for .NET Core
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

  shasum: /Users/dbrattli/Developer/GitHub/classlib/.paket/../paket-files/paket.restore.cached: 
  Paket version 5.188.1
  Starting full restore process.
  Performance:
   - Disk IO: 17 milliseconds
   - Runtime: 2 seconds
  Restoring packages for /Users/dbrattli/Developer/GitHub/classlib/classlib.csproj...
  Restore completed in 178.88 ms for /Users/dbrattli/Developer/GitHub/classlib/classlib.csproj.
  Paket version 5.188.1
  The last restore is still up to date. Nothing left to do.
  Performance:
   - Runtime: 60 milliseconds
  classlib -> /Users/dbrattli/Developer/GitHub/classlib/bin/Debug/netstandard2.0/classlib.dll
  Paket version 5.188.1
  Performance:
   - Runtime: 644 milliseconds
/Users/dbrattli/Developer/GitHub/classlib/.paket/Paket.Restore.targets(226,5): error : The provided SymbolPackageFormat value  is invalid. Allowed values : 'snupkg', 'symbols.nupkg'. [/Users/dbrattli/Developer/GitHub/classlib/classlib.csproj]
```

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   2.1.500
 Commit:    b68b931422

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Mac OS X
 OS Version:  10.14
 OS Platform: Darwin
 RID:         osx.10.14-x64
 Base Path:   /usr/local/share/dotnet/sdk/2.1.500/

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 2.1.6
  Commit:  3f4f8eebd8







_Copied from original issue: dotnet/cli#10345_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Error during restoring packages for solution with pcl project" (#7513) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I'm used **nuget.exe -v4.5**, but suppose that it's reproduced on the latest version.

I received error below during restoring solution with `PCL` project:
```
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018: The "WriteRestoreGraphTask" task failed unexpectedly. [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018: NuGet.Frameworks.NuGet.Frameworks1070473.FrameworkException: Invalid portable frameworks for '.NETPortable,Version=v4.5,Profile=Profile75'. 
    A portable framework must have at least one framework in the profile. [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.Frameworks.NuGet.Frameworks1070473.NuGetFramework.GetShortFolderName(NuGet.Frameworks1070473.IFrameworkNameProvider mappings) [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.ProjectModel.PackageSpecWriter.WriteMetadataTargetFrameworks(IObjectWriter writer, ProjectRestoreMetadata msbuildMetadata) [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.ProjectModel.PackageSpecWriter.SetMSBuildMetadata(IObjectWriter writer, PackageSpec packageSpec) [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.ProjectModel.PackageSpecWriter.Write(PackageSpec packageSpec, IObjectWriter writer) [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.ProjectModel.DependencyGraphSpec.Write(IObjectWriter writer, Action`2 writeAction) [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.ProjectModel.DependencyGraphSpec.GetJson() [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.ProjectModel.DependencyGraphSpec.Save(String path) [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at NuGet.Build.Tasks.WriteRestoreGraphTask.Execute() [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute() [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\ssksmcrz.5gq.nugetrestore.targets(132,5): error MSB4018:    at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.<ExecuteInstantiatedTask>d__26.MoveNext() [%localappdata%\Temp\NuGetScratch\dtuk4fmu.hcu.nugetinputs.targets]
```

I was surprised because the current portable framework has framework in the relevant profile.
After a couple investigation of nuget.exe I found that it [doesn't look around an optional profile](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Frameworks/NuGetFramework.cs#L187), that is a reason of error for the selected `Profile75`.

I expected that nuget.exe restore packages in the current case without errors.

P.S. profile cannot be changed from optional to regular 78 or someone else

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget restore failing and timing out" (#7512) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This is similar to this issue: [Nuget restore failing and timing out](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/324392/nuget-restore-failing-and-timing-out.html)

Nuget restore is timing out on one of our solutions after 2 minutes.  I've tried using multiple versions of Nuget and still get the same issue.   This is the only solution I've encountered this issue with, possibly because it's a very large solution (over 15,000 files spread out over 10 projects) but I don't know if that's the cause for sure.  We just converted this solution to .Net Standard 2.0, we didn't have issues before converting it and it builds fine inside Visual Studio.

Here is the full log from that task.

2018-11-15T14:18:34.2347606Z Task         : NuGet
2018-11-15T14:18:34.2348765Z Description  : Restore, pack, or push NuGet packages, or run a NuGet command. Supports NuGet.org and authenticated feeds like Package Management and MyGet. Uses NuGet.exe and works with .NET Framework apps. For .NET Core and .NET Standard apps, use the .NET Core task.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet plugin credential providers - is there a reason for displaying the process window?" (#7511) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When using NuGet plugin credential providers, the plugin process is started and displayed ([here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Plugins/PluginFactory.cs#L149).

Is there a reason for displaying the process window? Could the SDK be updated to set `WindowStyle = ProcessWindowStyle.Hidden` when starting the process?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove Dev14 hacks/scripts from the codebase" (#7112) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We need to remove everything dev14 related from the dev codebase. 

This means if-defs, build scripts etc. 

The target here is a harmless change, no logic changes anywhere in the codebase, merely janitorial work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Move the NuGet libraries to net472" (#7510) at NuGet/Home
Reopened issue "Fix NuGet's packages' metadata" (#6518) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Our NuGet packages should be updated to use the required metadata.

​Autho​rs
The Authors for the package should just be "Microsoft".

License URL - https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/LICENSE.txt
Requiring License Acceptance - true
​Project URL - https://github.com/NuGet/nuget.client/
Copyright - "© .NET Foundation. All rights reserved."
Logo
Update the package logos to use the new official nuget logo
